title: 110_hr3461
content:
The Act titled "Safeguarding America's Families by Enhancing and Reorganizing New and Efficient Technologies Act of 2007" addresses Internet safety, including safe online activity, secure online transactions, protection of financial information and privacy, cyber-crime threats, and risks to juveniles from cyber-predators and inappropriate material. The Federal Trade Commission will implement a nationwide program to raise awareness and educate the public on Internet safety. This program will utilize resources from various entities to promote best practices, conduct outreach campaigns, and facilitate the exchange of information to keep users informed about current issues. The Federal Trade Commission will implement a nationwide program to raise awareness and educate the public on Internet safety by facilitating access to education and awareness efforts for various entities. The Commission is required to submit an annual report to Congress detailing its activities from the previous year. Additionally, there is a provision for the establishment of an Online Safety and Technology Working Group. The Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information will establish an Online Safety and Technology working group within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The group will review industry efforts to promote online safety for children through various technologies and initiatives. The Online Safety and Technology working group will review industry efforts to promote online safety for children, including reporting child pornography, record retention practices, and technology development for parental controls on the Internet. A report detailing their findings and effectiveness of strategies and technologies will be submitted to the Assistant Secretary and the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives within 1 year of the group's establishment. The Online Safety and Technology working group will review industry efforts to promote online safety for children, including educational campaigns, parental control technologies, blocking and filtering software, labeling, and other technologies to assist parents. Recommendations for incentives to increase the effectiveness and implementation of these strategies and technologies will be included in the report. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS.

    Definitions for this Act:
            (1) Commission - Federal Trade Commission.
            (2) Internet - Computer and telecommunications facilities forming the worldwide network of networks using TCP/IP to communicate information.

SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

    $5,000,000 authorized for Commission for public awareness campaign in fiscal year 2008, available until September 30, 2009. Passed the House of Representatives on November 13, 2007. Attest: LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
